verses.verse: (A Psalm, a Song for the Sabbath day.) It is good <WH2896> to give <WH3034> thanks <WH3034> to the Lord, <WH3068> And to sing <WH2167> praises <WH2167> to Thy name, <WH8034> O Most <WH9411> High; <WH9411>
To declare <WH5046> Thy lovingkindness <WH2617> in the morning, <WH1242> And Thy faithfulness <WH530> by night, <WH3915>
With the ten-stringed lute, and with the harp; <WH5035> With resounding <WH1902> music <WH1902> upon the lyre. <WH3658>
For Thou, O Lord, <WH3068> hast made <WH8055> me glad <WH8055> by what <WH6467> Thou hast done, <WH6467> I will sing <WH7442> for joy <WH7442> at the works <WH4639> of Thy hands. <WH3027>
How <WH4100> great <WH1431> are Thy works, <WH4639> O Lord! <WH3068> Thy thoughts <WH4284> are very <WH3966> deep. <WH6009>
A senseless <WH1198> man <WH376> has <WH3045> no <WH3808> knowledge; <WH3045> Nor <WH3808> does a stupid <WH3684> man <WH3684> understand <WH995> this: <WH384>

That when the wicked <WH7563> sprouted <WH6524> up like <WH3644> grass, <WH6212> And all <WH3605> who did <WH6466> iniquity <WH205> flourished, <WH6692> It [was only] that they might be destroyed <WH8045> forevermore. <WH5704> <WH5703>
But Thou, O Lord, <WH3068> art on high <WH4791> forever. <WH5769>
For, behold, <WH2009> Thine enemies, <WH340> O Lord, <WH3068> For, behold, <WH2009> Thine enemies <WH340> will perish; All <WH6> who do <WH3605> iniquity <WH6466> will be scattered. <WH205>
But Thou hast exalted <WH7311> my horn <WH7161> like [that of] the wild <WH7214> ox; <WH7214> I have been anointed <WH1101> with fresh <WH7488> oil. <WH8081>
And my eye <WH5869> has looked <WH5027> [exultantly] upon my foes, <WH7790> My ears <WH241> hear <WH8085> of the evildoers <WH7489> who rise <WH6965> up against <WH5921> me.
The righteous <WH6662> man <WH6662> will flourish <WH6524> like the palm <WH8558> tree, <WH8558> He will grow <WH7685> like a cedar <WH730> in Lebanon. <WH3844>
Planted <WH8362> in the house <WH1004> of the Lord, <WH3068> They will flourish <WH6524> in the courts <WH2691> of our God. <WH430>
They will still <WH5750> yield <WH5107> fruit <WH5107> in old <WH7872> age; <WH7872> They shall be full <WH1879> of sap <WH1879> and very <WH7488> green, <WH7488>
To declare <WH5046> that the Lord <WH3068> is upright; <WH3477> [He is] my rock, <WH6697> and there is no <WH3808> unrighteousness <WH9390> in Him.
